fields.summary: Single location for upgrade log messages

status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
Hi All,

*Use Case*
Cloud administrator plans an upgrade from 3.4.2 to 3.4.3. He gathers all the required information and is prepared for the upgrade. He finally follows the upgrade documentation and performs the upgrade.

To his surprise after the upgrade some of his instances fails to show a keypair associated to them. These instances were running before the upgrade. This seems unusual to him because those keypairs are still visible to the cloud administrator via DescribeKeyPairs.

Looking out for more information on exactly what went wrong in the upgrade process he starts looking at the logs.

To his surprise most of the logs related to the upgrade process are basically of no help to him. In specific are:

a) upgrade.log - This file is basically logging a very simple information that is not consumable by cloud administrator as he cannot make anything out of it except the fact that the upgrade was a success

{code}
#                           UPGRADE INFORMATION
#================================================================================
# Old Version:              3.4.2
# New Version:              3.4.3
# Upgrade keys:             false              using:
# Upgrade configuration:    false              using:
# Upgrade database:         true               using: upgrade_db
# Same version:             false              using:
# Start upgrading: db
//usr/sbin/eucalyptus-cloud -u eucalyptus -h / --upgrade  --upgrade-old-version=3.4.2 --upgrade-old-dir=/var/lib/eucalyptus/upgrade/eucalyptus.backup.1406222890
Upgrading your database...
ulimit: resource=7 soft=65536 hard=65536
ulimit: resource=6 soft=385877 hard=385877
ulimit: resource=6 soft=-1 hard=-1
ulimit: resource=7 soft=65536 hard=65536
ulimit: resource=6 soft=385877 hard=385877
ulimit: resource=6 soft=-1 hard=-1
ulimit: resource=7 soft=65536 hard=65536
ulimit: resource=6 soft=385877 hard=385877
ulimit: resource=6 soft=-1 hard=-1
# Done upgrading:  db
{code}

Couple of immediate improvements to be included in upgrade.log are to have timestamps on when the upgrade was started and when it got completed. The timestamps are logged in the {{database_events}} database under database_upgrade_log this information is useful for the cloud administrator and should be provided in the upgrade.log

Currently it shows

{code}
--
-- Data for Name: database_upgrade_log; Type: TABLE DATA; Schema: public; Owner: eucalyptus
--

COPY database_upgrade_log (id, "timestamp", upgrade_from_version, upgrade_to_version, upgrade_state) FROM stdin;
55603272-306a-41ef-a4cf-043ef165a2c0    2014-07-24 21:55:09.204 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  BEGIN_UPGRADE
06ce1a69-d97f-40ff-a4a8-e558365f6fb6    2014-07-24 21:55:09.23  v3_4_2  v3_4_3  PRE_BACKINGUP_DATABASE
90a33724-99c7-49ea-9455-3f41d53af961    2014-07-24 21:55:34.146 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  PRE_COPYING_DATABASES
010b92b9-2bf1-4f23-bf4f-1f39131c77e6    2014-07-24 21:55:42.795 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  PRE_SCHEMA_UPDATE
e09d8ec4-4553-415a-96a8-40c813c8dab7    2014-07-24 21:55:51.597 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  PRE_SETUP_JPA
b14d3b41-5275-4803-9af1-110389527c98    2014-07-24 21:55:51.624 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  RUN_PRE_UPGRADE
8df219d5-452e-46f8-bba6-e4955d25cf34    2014-07-24 21:55:51.78  v3_4_2  v3_4_3  RUN_ENTITY_UPGRADE
dbfefbab-f2f7-436d-99fa-afe73513c554    2014-07-24 21:55:51.808 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  RUN_POST_UPGRADE
bed34ff8-b20f-4c4f-a253-526059c0be25    2014-07-24 21:55:51.839 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  POST_SHUTDOWN_JPA
c1ffbd0d-875e-40e8-ace3-c0141bcfbc77    2014-07-24 21:55:54.132 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  POST_DELETE_ORIG_DB
add831f4-4a70-4ed1-a48d-b5fb63e37445    2014-07-24 21:55:54.578 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  POST_RENAME_NEW_TO_ORIG_DB
78dea3a2-1bbe-4171-a397-8b85414ba39e    2014-07-24 21:55:56.507 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  POST_DELETE_OLD_DB
7d2a7a1a-4f1d-4cb1-9049-07f9f04073ac    2014-07-24 21:55:56.531 v3_4_2  v3_4_3  COMPLETED
{code}

On top of the timestamps we need to also make sure the log messages pertaining to upgrade are not getting logged into cloud-output.log only. If they can be logged into upgrade.log that would be considered as a huge improvement because then the cloud administrator has 1 single file to look at for logs from the upgrade process. Most of the time the logs in cloud-output.log will get rotated and if the administrator has spend considerable time in identifying system weirdness he looses that window of time to get the right logs.

b) startup.log - This log file logs all the messages generated by the system when it get started or stopped or something unusual happens like a cloud administrator performs a {{kill -3}} to collect thread dumps. Except thread dumps at-least all other messages getting logged into this file needs to have timestamp otherwise there is no meaning in reading the log file.

Some of the messages logged in the file are

{code}
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space
Dumping heap to //var/log/eucalyptus/java_pid30137.hprof ...
Heap dump file created [353355026 bytes in 3.020 secs]
330943917 [RequestQueue.1523] ERROR com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper  - java.lang.Thread.getStackTrace(Thread.java:1567)
com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper$1.uncaughtException(SystemBootstrapper.java:163)
java.lang.ThreadGroup.uncaughtException(ThreadGroup.java:1057)
java.lang.ThreadGroup.uncaughtException(ThreadGroup.java:1052)
java.lang.Thread.dispatchUncaughtException(Thread.java:1964)
330943917 [EucalyptusRequestQueue.1594] ERROR com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper  - java.lang.Thread.getStackTrace(Thread.java:1567)
com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper$1.uncaughtException(SystemBootstrapper.java:163)
java.lang.ThreadGroup.uncaughtException(ThreadGroup.java:1057)
java.lang.ThreadGroup.uncaughtException(ThreadGroup.java:1052)
java.lang.Thread.dispatchUncaughtException(Thread.java:1964)
330943917 [RequestQueue.1522] ERROR com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper  - java.lang.Thread.getStackTrace(Thread.java:1567)
com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper$1.uncaughtException(SystemBootstrapper.java:163)
java.lang.ThreadGroup.uncaughtException(ThreadGroup.java:1057)
java.lang.ThreadGroup.uncaughtException(ThreadGroup.java:1052)
java.lang.Thread.dispatchUncaughtException(Thread.java:1964)
330943918 [RequestQueue.1523] ERROR com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper  - org.mule.api.MuleRuntimeException: An exception occurred while invoking message processor "org.mule.service.processor.ServiceInternalMessageProcessor" for asynchronously.
{code}

For all these messages there could be corresponding messages in the fault log or the error logs but startup.log has no information about timestamps which could be useful to correlate certain important events with system start-stop-kill-3 etc.

In general speaking there could be a problem specific to the use case which needs to be looked at separately but this improvement tries to capture what the product can do to improve the debugging of the system after a weird result is shown after the upgrade is successfully complete.

Please let me know if you have any questions or feedback.

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: Better logging request for cloud upgrade use cases

comments.body: todo : break up this issue into multiple bugs.
